intro: Stellaria cuonaensis, commonly known as the Cuona starwort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it adapts to cold and harsh conditions. Its small, white or pink flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces small, rounded fruits. Stellaria cuonaensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
